info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 9 at 2:30PM MDT until July 9 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow MT
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 95. For the Lake Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph expected.
* WHERE...Central and Southeast Phillips, Central and Southern Valley, Garfield, McCone, and Petroleum Counties.
* WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 9 PM MDT this evening. For the Lake Wind Advisory, from 10 AM to 9 PM MDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Strong winds and rough waves on area lakes will create hazardous conditions for small craft. Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect wave heights up to 4 feet.
info.instruction:
Boaters on Fort Peck Lake should use extra caution since strong winds and rough waves can overturn small craft.
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.
Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
